intro: Schnizleinia nitida, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
